com.mapquest.android.maps
Interface Overlay.Snappable

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultItemizedOverlay, ItemizedOverlay
Enclosing class:
Overlay
public static interface Overlay.Snappable

When a touch event causes a zoom in and this interface is implemented in your overlay this onSnapToItem will be called to give the overlay a chance to reposition the point that is getting zoomed into. This allows you to help the user focus on a particular point given the inaccuracies of touch events.

Method Summary
 boolean onSnapToItem(int x, int y, android.graphics.Point snapPoint, MapView mapView)
          Called during a zoom in touch event
 

Method Detail

onSnapToItem

boolean onSnapToItem(int x,
                     int y,
                     android.graphics.Point snapPoint,
                     MapView mapView)
Called during a zoom in touch event

Parameters:
x - the x pixel coordinate of the screen about to be zoomed in to
y - the y pixel coordinate of the screen about to be zoomed in to
snapPoint - the Point object your overlay should populate if return in true, this is the point the zoom function will zoom in on
mapView - the mapview that is being zoomed in on
Returns:
return true if you are changing the zoom point and don't forget to populate the snapPoint object with the coordinates you want to zoom in on, otherwise return false if no change is necessary
